P002817.project_name: Financial and Legal Management Upgrading Project (FILMUP)

keywords.cdata: account,accountability,Accountancy,Accountants,Accounting,Accounting & Auditing Standards,accounting standards,accounts,audit reports,Auditing,Auditors,audits,Authority,authorization,Bank of Tanzania,bankruptcy,bills,budgetary allocations,Certified Public Accountants,Civil Service,colonies,Commercial Law,common law,conflict of interests,consensus,consolidation,Constitution,Copyright,Cost Estimates,Cost Recovery,court system,deficits,economic development,Economic Reform,expenditure,financial assistance,financial institutions,Financial Management,financial resources,FISCAL,FISCAL YEAR,foreign assistance,foreign exchange,good governance,Government Accounting,government agencies,Government institutions,housing,human rights,insurance,Intellectual Property,islamic law,Judiciary,law libraries,Law Reform,Laws,lawyers,legal education,Legal framework,legal institutions,Legal Profession,legal professions,legal reform,Legal System,Legislation,operating costs,parastatal organizations,parastatal reform,parastatals,personal property,private housing,privatization,Procurement,Public Administration,public finances,public ownership,Public Sector,public sector accountability,Public Service,regulatory body,regulatory framework,Reporting,rule of law,social security,social security administration,structural adjustment,technical assistance,USAID

project_abstract.cdata: The objectives of the project are to improve accounting and auditing standards on the one hand, and the legal framework and the administration of justice on the other by strengthening key institutions.  The project will provide assistance for: (a) financial management improvement through; (i) upgrading of accounting and auditing, training, technical assistance, office, classroom and transport equipment, and office and residential accommodations; (b) upgrading of the legal sector through: (i) training and limited office and computer equipment; and (ii) revision and publication of the laws of Tanzania; (c) studies including:  (i) a legal sector study to prepare a detailed strategy for the development of the legal sector; (ii) a cost recovery study to suggest ways of improving cost recovery in project beneficiary institutions, and (iii) a Tanzania Audit Corporation study to suggest practical steps necessary for implementing the government decision to open up the audit of parastatal accounts to competition; and (d) project coordination to pay for the office costs and salaries of two project coordinators:  one for the financial management component, and the other for the legal sector component, and the incremental operating costs of project institutions.
